description: GenuVerity Quality Audit Rubric - Fact-Checking the Fact-Checker

criteria.name: Source Credibility
criteria.description: Are sources authoritative for this specific claim domain?

levels.excellent: All sources are primary or high-authority for the claim domain
levels.good: Majority of sources are primary; some reputable secondary
levels.acceptable: Mix of primary and secondary; some weak sources
levels.poor: Relies heavily on opinion pieces or low-authority sources

criteria.name: Direct Relevance
criteria.description: Do sources directly address the claim or only tangentially?

levels.excellent: Sources directly address the specific claim being evaluated
levels.good: Most sources relevant; some provide background only
levels.acceptable: Some sources stretch to relate to the claim
levels.poor: Sources don't clearly support conclusions drawn

criteria.name: Evidence Completeness
criteria.description: Is contradictory evidence acknowledged and addressed?

criteria.name: Quote/Context Integrity
criteria.description: Are quotes full and properly contextualized?

levels.excellent: Full quotes with clear context provided
levels.good: Quotes are accurate with reasonable truncation
levels.acceptable: Some quotes truncated but meaning preserved
levels.poor: Quotes taken out of context or misleadingly truncated

criteria.name: Reasoning Transparency
criteria.description: Is the logic explicitly stated, not implied?

levels.excellent: Clear 'because X, therefore Y' reasoning throughout
levels.good: Reasoning mostly explicit with minor gaps
levels.acceptable: Some reasoning implied rather than stated
levels.poor: Reader must guess how evidence connects to verdict

criteria.name: Fallacy Avoidance
criteria.description: Free from strawman, false dichotomy, circular reasoning?

levels.excellent: No logical fallacies; addresses strongest opposing arguments
levels.good: Minor logical shortcuts but fundamentally sound
levels.acceptable: Some weak reasoning but conclusions defensible
levels.poor: Contains clear logical fallacies or circular reasoning

criteria.name: Complexity Recognition
criteria.description: Does it handle 'it depends' scenarios appropriately?

criteria.name: Charitable Interpretation
criteria.description: Addresses strongest version of opposing argument?

criteria.name: Underlying Concerns
criteria.description: Explains WHY people believe the false claim?

levels.good: Notes some reasons for belief spread
levels.acceptable: Focuses only on proving claim wrong

criteria.name: Scope Match
criteria.description: Does verdict address what was actually claimed?

levels.excellent: Verdict precisely matches the claim scope
levels.good: Verdict mostly matches with minor scope variance
levels.acceptable: Some mismatch between claim and verdict scope
levels.poor: Verdict addresses different claim than stated

criteria.name: Verdict Category Accuracy
criteria.description: Correct verdict type (false vs misleading vs context)?

levels.excellent: Verdict category perfectly matches evidence type
levels.acceptable: Verdict could arguably be different category
levels.poor: Wrong verdict category for the evidence presented

criteria.name: Evidence-Verdict Alignment
criteria.description: Does verdict strength match evidence strength?

levels.excellent: Strong evidence for strong verdict; appropriate hedging
levels.acceptable: Verdict slightly stronger than evidence warrants
levels.poor: Verdict not supported by evidence presented

vague-authority.description: Claims about what 'experts say' without naming specific experts or studies

truncated-quote.description: Quotes with ellipsis that may strip important context

opinion-source.description: Opinion/editorial source used for factual claim

opinion-source-url.description: Blog or opinion domain used as evidence

circular-reasoning.description: Conclusion restates premise without independent evidence

missing-counter-argument.description: Doesn't address why people believe the false claim

thin-evidence.description: Strong verdict with fewer than 6 sources

generic-link-text.description: Link text like 'click here' instead of descriptive text
